task.title: Migrate Instances Between Node Controllers
task.shortdesc: In order to ensure optimal system performance, or to perform system maintenance, it is sometimes necessary to move running instances between Node Controllers (NCs). You can migrate instances individually, or migrate all instances from a given NC.

keywords.indexterm: cloud tasks evacuate a Node Controller migrate instances

context.note: For migrations to succeed, you must have INSTANCE_PATH set to the same value in the eucalyptus.conf file on each Node Controller.

These flags may be used more than once to specify multiple Node Controllers.

info.p: You can also optionally specify --stop-source, to stop the specified Node Controller and ensure that no new instances are started on that NC while the migration occurs. This allows you to safely remove the NC without interrupting running instances. The NC will remain in the DISABLED state until it is explicitly enabled using euca-modify-service -s start [NC IP].

step.cmd: In some cases, timeouts may cause a migration to initially fail. Run the command again to complete the migration.
